thread.title: Kyle Maher: Young father who was stabbed to death in Tooting had got engaged days earlier
thread.title_full: Kyle Maher: Young father who was stabbed to death in Tooting had got engaged days earlier

author: Barney Davis
title: Kyle Maher: Young father who was stabbed to death in Tooting had got engaged days earlier
text:
Monday 23 January 2017 09:08 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard 'Perfect father': Kyle Maher with his daughter 
A young father was allegedly stabbed to death in front of his fiancée after a row at his home, his devastated family said today. 
Kyle Maher, 21, is said to have been knifed repeatedly in the heart, neck, stomach and head and died in hospital from his horrific injuries. 
The landscape gardener is believed to have been with his fiancée, 17, who was stabbed through the hand as she tried to shield him from an attacker. 
Mr Maher’s body was found in the corridor of his shared house in Tooting where he had celebrated his first Christmas with his new daughter. 
As he lay dying, Mr Maher tried to say his last words to his injured partner but they were too quiet for her to understand, his family said. Stab victim: Kyle Maher (PA) 
Mr Maher had announced his engagement on Facebook days earlier. 
Forensic officers on Sunday night remained at the scene at his flatshare in Drakefield Road, Tooting, south London after the stabbing at 3am on Saturday. 
Luke McGarrett, a cousin, paid tribute to Mr Maher describing him as the “perfect father figure” for his new daughter, who was born last year to a former partner. 
The 22-year-old told the Standard: “All he wanted was the chance to raise his baby girl, she was his diamond in the sky. 
“He absolutely adored her and would spend all the money he had on her just to make her happy - even if he was left skint. 
“She had just begun to walk and was learning how to say ‘daddy’ but now she will never see him again. 
“I’ve visited his partner in hospital and she is traumatised, she is going to needs lots of support. Man stabbed to death in quiet south London road 
“His mother is distraught. Since he was born Kyle has been her baby boy, her only boy. She keeps thinking he is going to call her on the phone and it’s all been a misunderstanding. 
“I saw him in the morgue and held his cold hand and said ‘Get some rest, I’ll see you soon.’” 
The house is split into five flats, and is thought to be run by a charity which supports homeless and vulnerable people to live in decent homes. Mr Maher had lived in a room in the house for just under a year. 
Neighbours on the road were woken by muffled shouts, loud banging of doors and a woman in “hysterics” with cut arms in the early hours of Saturday morning. 
The teenager remains in hospital where her condition is not believed to be life-threatening. 
She posted a tribute on Facebook from her hospital bed, reading: “I love you. Rest in peace baby, I’ll always think of you everyday and we are all here thinking of you and I will fight your corner. I’m so proud of you, my strong soldier. Love you so much, just wish you [were] here.” 
Anyone with information is asked to contact the incident room on 020 8721 4868 or via 101. They can also call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111. 
Richard Wilson-Michael, 29, of Drakefield Road, SW17, will appear in custody at Bromley Magistrates’ court on January 23 charged with the murder, GBH and possession of an offensive weapon. More about:
